modName: The Poor Man's Rest - Markarth Warrens Player Home
summary: Turns one of the rooms in the Warrens into a small and dingy player home
descriptionHtml:
[heading][color=red][b]The Poor Man's Rest - Markarth Warrens Player Home[/b][/color][/heading]

[i]"You don't want to be here. No one wants to."[/i]

But sadly, you don't have a choice. The Warrens in Markarth is where you go if you can't afford a bed, food or even clean drinking water. The Silver-Blood family has finally cleared out one of the rooms after a rock collapse, leaving another room free for a dirty beggar or a coal-stained laborer. Garvey has lost the key somewhere though...

This mod simply adds in a small room for the player in the Warrens. It doesn't have everything a Dovahkiin desires, but it does has everything a poor man needs to survive a night in Markarth. This is great for people who are playing a beggar or poor character, or for people who just want a free bed in Markarth without all the bells and whistles.

[b]Full Features:[/b]

* Two beds, both player owned
* Storage chest
* Alchemy table
* Unique clothing (head and arm bandages) for humanoids and Bosmer
* Cooking pot
* And completely free

[color=darkorange]=====[b]Installation[/b]=====[/color]

Just download and drop the file into your data folder.
Or just use the NMM.
To uninstall, just remove the file.

[color=darkorange]====[b]Compatibility[/b]====[/color]

[i]Compatible:[/i]
Pretty much everything. I have not yet found a mod that edits the Warrens.

[i]Incompatible:[/i]
Anything that changes or adjusts the blocked off room in between Cosnach and Eltry's room

color=darkorange]=====[b]Permissions and Credits[/b]=====[/color]
This mod is not to be uploaded anywhere but the Skyrim Nexus. Please report to me if you see this anywhere else.
Thanks to Bethesda for creating a great game and letting us fiddle with it.

[color=red]Thanks for reading and check my page for more mods![/color]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/7065334/?tb=mods&pUp=1 ] [IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/2dryws3.png[/IMG][/url]
author: Tae-Rai
